Submodules

api_validator.action module

action.py

This module contains the primary code for the GitHub Action. Using the parsed OpenAPI specs and step files, it will create API requests and validate the responses.

api_validator.action.check_endpoint_coverage(spec_data: dict, steps_data: dict)

Checks the endpoint coverage of the step file against the OpenAPI spec.

Parameters

  • spec_data (dict) – The parsed OpenAPI spec

  • steps_data (dict) – The parsed step file

Raises

UndocumentedEndpointError –

api_validator.action.make_requests(spec_data: dict, steps_data: dict, fail_fast: bool, verbose: bool)

Given a parsed OpenAPI spec and step file, make requests and validate responses.

Parameters

  • spec_data (dict) – The parsed OpenAPI spec

  • steps_data (dict) – The parsed step file

  • fail_fast (bool) – Whether to exit immediately if exception raised

  • verbose (bool) – Whether to output stacktrace

Raises

  • ResponseMatchError – If the response does not match the expected response according to status code

  • ResponseValidationError – If the response does not match the expected response according to schema

api_validator.action.parse_spec_steps(spec_file_path: str, step_file_path: str) → tuple[dict, dict]

Parses the OpenAPI spec and step files and return each of them

Parameters

  • spec_file_path (str) – The path to the OpenAPI spec file

  • step_file_path (str) – The path to the step file

Returns

A 2-tuple of dictionaries, containing the parsed OpenAPI spec and step files

Raises

  • FileNotFoundError – If the spec or step file does not exist

  • ValidationError – If the spec file is not valid according to the OpenAPI standard

  • ScannerError – If the step file is not valid YAML

  • JSONValidatorError – If the step file instance is not valid according to the JSON schema

api_validator.action.verify_api(spec_file_path: str, step_file_path: str, fail_fast: bool = False, verbose: bool = False)

This is the main function of the API verifier. It parses the OpenAPI spec and step files, measures coverage, makes requests, and validates responses. If this method completes without raising any exceptions, the API is considered valid.

Parameters

  • spec_file_path (str) – The path to the OpenAPI spec file

  • step_file_path (str) – The path to the step file

  • fail_fast (bool) – Whether to exit immediately if exception raised

  • verbose (bool) – Whether to output stacktrace

api_validator.errors module

errors.py

This module contains custom errors for the API validator. Often, these errors are raised when a library gives an error with a difficult to read message. These errors will nicely format these error messages for logging and stack traces.

exception api_validator.errors.InsufficientCoverageError(achieved_coverage: float, target_coverage: float, uncovered: set[str])

Bases: BaseException

Raised the step file does not sufficiently cover the OpenAPI spec according the the coverage threshold. If a coverage threshold given in the step file, this error will halt further execution of the action.

exception api_validator.errors.JSONValidatorError(errors: list[dict[str, str]])

Bases: BaseException

Raised when the structure of a JSON does not match the expected JSON schema. This error will halt further execution of the action.

exception api_validator.errors.ResponseMatchError(statuses: list, step: api_validator.models.response.Response)

Bases: BaseException

Raised when a response does not match any of the expected responses in the OpenAPI spec according to status code. This error will halt further execution of the action.

exception api_validator.errors.ResponseValidationError(errors: list, url: str, method: str, status_code: int)

Bases: BaseException

Raised when the structure of a response does not match the expected schema in the OpenAPI spec. This error will halt further execution of the action.

exception api_validator.errors.UndocumentedEndpointError(undocumented: set[str])

Bases: BaseException

Raised when the step file contains endpoints that are not documented in the OpenAPI spec. This error will halt further execution of the action.

api_validator.parsing module

parsing.py

This module contains functions for parsing the input file. It will parse input files, returning a nested dictionary object. If the input file is not valid, it will raise an exception.

api_validator.parsing.parse_spec(spec_file_path: str) → dict

Parse OpenAPI spec file to a dictionary.

Parameters

spec_file_path (str) – Path to spec file.

Returns

Spec file parsed into a dictionary.

Return type

dict

Raises

  • ValidationError – If the spec file is not valid according to the OpenAPI spec.

  • ResolutionError – If the spec file has refs cannot be resolved

  • ruamel.yaml.scanner.ScannerError –

api_validator.parsing.parse_steps(step_file_path: str) → dict

Parse steps file to a dictionary.

Parameters

step_file_path (str) – Path to step file.

Returns

Step file parsed into a dictionary.

Return type

dict

Raises

  • FileNotFoundError – If the step file does not exist.

  • yaml.scanner.ScannerError – If the step file is not valid YAML.

  • JSONValidatorError – If the step file is not valid against the step file schema.

api_validator.preprocessing module

preprocessing.py

This module contains functions to ensure compatibility for a step file and corresponding spec file. It will check that every method referenced in the step file exists in the spec file.

class api_validator.preprocessing.EndpointCoverage(covered: set[str], uncovered: set[str], undocumented: set[str])

Bases: object

Dictionary classifying endpoints into three categories:

  • covered: endpoints that are called in the step file and documented in the spec file

  • uncovered: endpoints that are in the spec file but not called in the step file

  • undocumented: endpoints that are called in the step file but not documented in the spec file

covered: set[str]
has_undocumented_endpoints() → bool
proportion_covered() → float
uncovered: set[str]
undocumented: set[str]
api_validator.preprocessing.get_endpoint_coverage(spec: dict, step: dict) → api_validator.preprocessing.EndpointCoverage

Given a parsed spec and step file, determine the endpoints in the spec that are achieved by the step file.

Parameters

  • spec (dict) – specification file parsed as dict

  • step (dict) – step file parsed as dict

Returns

A dataclass containing the endpoints covered, uncovered, and undocumented

Return type

EndpointCoverage
